Award.AwardTitle: Doctoral Consortium at the 2015 International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA 2015)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration: This proposal will support U.S. Ph.D. students working in robotics the opportunity to share their knowledge and interact with each other and more senior researchers, to learn about different sub-fields within robotics, to meet potential employers, and to become apprised of new technology that will be demonstrated by vendors. This goal will be accomplished by partially supporting the travel costs for U.S. Ph.D. students to attend the International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA), which is one of the two flagship conference of the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society. The conference attracts an international group of attendees that includes academics, industry workers, entrepreneurs, and funding agency leaders.
